source.author: Flann, C
source.title: Bracteantha
source.citation: From: Flann, C (1999). Bracteantha. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria 4, pp. 749-752. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Rhizomatous perennials, usually with a single capitulum
Taprooted annuals or perennials, usually with several to many capitula
Outer surface of bracts smooth; lowlands
Outer surface of bracts minutely scabrous; alpine or montane
Cauline leaves narrow-oblanceolate to narrow-oblong 2–10 mm wide, upper surface with sessile glands; stems becoming glabrescent in lower portion; lanky, somewhat sparse herbs of swampy areas

Cauline leaves elliptic-oblanceolate, 5–22 mm wide, upper surface with at least some stipitate glands or glands absent; stems hairy throughout; rather stout, dense, colony-forming herb of grasslands, herbfields and heathlands often adjacent to water courses but usually not in swampy areas
Involucral bracts white, florets orange; offshore islands near (and possibly on) Wilsons Promontory
Involucral bracts and florets yellow; widespread
Leaves not viscid, elliptic to linear, to 3.0 cm wide
Leaves viscid, narrow-linear, to 0.4 cm wide
